post.body: Having a dog has been proven to decrease high blood pressure. We love dogs.
Meta-tweets are a bit strange esp. since the medium is in its infancy. Maybe it's cuz we now skip directly to the self reflective stage
Noticed that a lot of the tweets are meta: tweets about how to tweet & how to blog. V useful, but strange that there'd be so many.
First official day back at work: 2009 kinda feels like 2008. Let's hope it's a lot better though.
Happy day after New Year! Bet you don't see a lot of those. (Haven't twittered for a few days now. First official post for the New Year.)
Intrigued by the whole e-book thing. I think it's going to tip soon. I won't take the plunge yet: will wait for Amazon and Sony to do battle
Just finished Gladwell's The Tipping Point: I wonder if Twitter has allowed for any trends to tip?
Is bucketing snow up at Tahoe. It'll be a lovely white Xmas indeed.
Compiling the all time best Xmas playlist: I'd say that Feed the World has gotta top the list followed closely by Fairytale of New York.
Ahhh Shopping the last weekend before Xmas -- the madness. But I suppose it must be done.
Houseguests coming today for the holidays...All the way from Ireland. Here to infuse some much needed euros into the retail sector.
It's refreshing to walk down new streets in San Francisco. Just saw three cool new hang outs - Terroir, Beerspot and Laundromat (a cafe).
Spoiler alert! Staying in the Christmas spirit, no one got voted off Top Chef last nite although it sounds like plenty deserved to.
Haven't tweeted all day: I knew something was missing, but I just couldn't put my finger on it. Ahhh- much better now.
Sucks to be sick. Feels like it takes twice as much energy to do anything. Plus you can't really taste anything. Stay healthy everybody!
California weather is like Connemara's: rain then sun, or rather rain & sun. A spectacular combo of grey and orange/red/brown.
Snow in downtown San Francisco this morning - no joke. Brrrr!
Made it through another Christmas party today. Seems like the more you go to, the easier they get. Kind of like most things in life, right?
Have a coherent vision for my online presence (I think): Twitter-Keep the group small cuz I actually update it. Facebook-Invite anybody.
Am donating the Pupmobile to charity today. Ahhh the memories. I'll miss that car...sort of.
